intro: Edraianthus pilosulus, commonly known as the hairy edraianthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. Edraianthus pilosulus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
